intro: Brickellia secundiflora var. monticola, commonly known as mountain brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with a low, spreading growth habit, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in dense, terminal clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies in arid and semi-arid regions.
